info.description:
ZeroTier Central Network Management Portal API.

All API requests must have an API token header specified in the Authorization: token xxxxx format. You can generate your API key by logging into ZeroTier Central and creating a token on the Account page.

eg. curl -X GET -H "Authorization: token xxxxx" https://api.zerotier.com/api/v1/network

Rate Limiting

The ZeroTier Central API implements rate limiting. Paid users are limited to 100 requests per second. Free users are limited to 20 requests per second.

You can get the OpenAPI spec here as well: https://docs.zerotier.com/openapi/centralv1.json
info.title: ZeroTier Central API

tags.name: organizations
tags.description: Organization management. Note: Organizations require a paid account and cannot be created via the API

get.summary: Obtain the overall status of the account tied to the API token in use.
Returns a list of Networks you have access to.

parameters.name: networkID
parameters.description: ID of the network to return

parameters.name: networkID
parameters.description: ID of the network to change

get.summary: Returns a list of Members on the network.

parameters.name: networkID
parameters.description: ID of the network to return

get.summary: Return an individual member on a network

post.summary: Update user record (SMS number or Display Name only)

delete.description: Deletes the user and all associated networks.  This is not reversible. Delete at your own risk.

post.summary: Invite a user to your organization by email

get.description: Get a random 32 character.  Used by the web UI to generate API keys

description.example: Some descriptive text about my network.

onlineMemberCount.description: Note: May be 0 on endpoints returning lists of Networks

enableBroadcast.description: Enable broadcast packets on the network

ipAssignmentPools.description: Range of IP addresses for the auto assign pool

lastModified.description: Time the network was last modified

mtu.description: MTU to set on the client virtual network adapter

multicastLimit.description: Maximum number of recipients per multicast or broadcast. Warning - Setting this to 0 will disable IPv4 communication on your network!

private.description: Whether or not the network is private.  If false, members will *NOT* need to be authorized to join.

id.description: concatenation of network ID and member ID

hidden.description: Whether or not the member is hidden in the UI

name.description: User defined name of the member

description.example: My super awesome cray that I got ZeroTier to run on
description.description: User defined description of the member

lastOnline.description: Last seen time of the member.  Note: This data is considered ephemeral and may be reset to 0 at any time without warning.

physicalAddress.description: IP address the member last spoke to the controller via.  Note: This data is considered ephemeral and may be reset to 0 at any time without warning.

clientVersion.description: ZeroTier version the member is running

supportsRulesEngine.description: Whether or not the client version is new enough to support the rules engine (1.4.0+)

activeBridge.description: Allow the member to be a bridge on the network

authorized.description: Is the member authorized on the network

creationTime.description: Time the member was created or first tried to join the network

id.description: ID of the member node.  This is the 10 digit identifier that identifies a ZeroTier node.

identity.description: Public Key of the member's Identity

lastAuthorizedTime.description: Time the member was authorized on the network

lastDeauthorizedTime.description: Time the member was deauthorized on the network

noAutoAssignIps.description: Exempt this member from the IP auto assignment pool on a Network

tags.description: Array of 2 member tuples of tag [ID, tag value]

ownerId.description: User ID of the organization owner

update_time.description: Last updated time of the invitation

domain.description: Search domain to use for DNS records

servers.description: IP address of unicast DNS service

token.description: API Token.  Minimum 32 characters. This token is encrypted in the database and can not be retrieved once set

hex.description: hex encoded random bytes of the token
